name: Tofu and Brown Rice Lettuce Wraps with Peanut Sauce
description: These lettuce wraps are ridiculously good! Crunchy, fresh, and packed with tofu, brown rice, crispy onions, plus a drizzle of peanut sauce and spicy mayo. Delicious!
keywords: lettuce wraps, vegan lettuce wraps, tofu lettuce wraps
recipeIngredient: One 14-ounce block extra firm tofu – minimally pressed to remove water
about 2 cups cooked brown rice and/or quinoa or other grains – I use the 8.5 ounce precooked packages so it’s very, very easy
butter lettuce or leaf lettuce for wrapping
chopped peanuts or crispy onions for topping
a squirt of Sriracha or other chile sauce if you want

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a few swishes of oil in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add the tofu and crumble in the pan. Cook until slightly browned. While that’s cooking, whisk up all sauce ingredients in a bowl.

video.description: Cook the tofu: Heat a few swishes of oil in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add the tofu and crumble in the pan. Cook until slightly browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rice and most of the sauce to the pan. Saut√© for 5 minutes or so – just enough to get some browning / light caramelization and get everything nice and yummy. Season with salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Add rice and sauce

video.name: Tofu and Brown Rice Lettuce Wraps with Peanut Sauce Step 2
video.description: Add rice and sauce: Add the rice and most of the sauce to the pan. Saut√© for 5 minutes or so - just enough to get some browning / light caramelization and get everything nice and yummy. Season with salt to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon your tofu and brown rice filling into crispy little pieces of lettuce. Top with something crunchy (peanuts? crispy onions?) and something creamy (spicy mayo all the way) and drizzle with a little extra sauce, and now tell me this isn’t your favorite meal of the week.
